intro: Beringia bursifolia, commonly known as the Alaska bursleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic regions of North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its biennial growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are lobed and often have a distinctive burs-like appearance, giving it its common name. Beringia bursifolia thrives in cold, nutrient-poor soils and is adapted to the harsh conditions of the Arctic tundra.
